item.title: 美国对伊朗实施新制裁，原油市场震荡，石油上涨
item.description: 在特朗普政府对伊朗石油流动实施新制裁后，石油延续涨势，称此举是对德黑兰恢复最大施压战略。【原文：Oil extended a gain after the Trump administration imposed new sanctions on flows of Iranian oil, framing the move as a return to a strategy of maximum pressure against Tehran.】

item.title: 中国主动型股票基金在科技股上涨中击败指数追随者
item.description: 中国的主动管理型股票基金在科技股大涨的背景下表现优于指数型基金，重新成为市场关注的焦点。【原文：China’s actively managed equities funds have returned to the limelight, outperforming their index-tracking peers in a tech-driven rally.】

item.title: 中国捍卫货币对大型银行和债券基金造成影响
item.description: 中国通过扼杀本地流动性来捍卫本国货币的策略正在整个金融体系激起涟漪，挤压银行，加剧债券基金的损失。【原文：China’s strategy of defending its currency by choking local liquidity is sending ripples throughout the financial system, squeezing banks and fueling losses at bond funds.】

item.title: 伍德赛德公司净利润增长一倍多，产量创历史新高
item.description: 伍德赛德能源集团（Woodside Energy Group Ltd.）的净收入翻了一番多，因为这家澳大利亚液化天然气生产商的产量达到了创纪录的水平。【原文：Woodside Energy Group Ltd.’s net income more than doubled as the Australian liquefied natural gas producer’s output rose to a record.】

item.title: 美国向中国施压，亚洲股市注定下跌：市场综述
item.description: 受华尔街盘中表现不佳以及特朗普政府遏制美国对华贸易的最新举措的拖累，整个亚洲地区的股市将出现大幅下跌。【原文：Asian stocks are poised for hefty losses throughout the region, dragged by a poor session on Wall Street and the Trump administration’s latest moves to curb US trade with China.】

item.title: Chegg起诉Alphabet，称谷歌人工智能引发商业评论
item.description: Chegg公司正在权衡其业务的 "战略替代方案"，称谷歌推出人工智能摘要工具后，其网络教育平台的流量已经锐减。【原文：Chegg Inc. is weighing “strategic alternatives” for its business, saying that traffic to its web-based education platform has been decimated following Google’s launch of an artificial intelligence-powered summary tool.】

item.title: Anthropic 预计新一轮估值将达 615 亿美元
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，人工智能初创公司Anthropic即将达成一项交易，以615亿美元的估值融资35亿美元。【原文：Artificial intelligence startup Anthropic is nearing a deal to raise $3.5 billion at a valuation of $61.5 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter — a larger funding round than the company initially planned to raise.】

item.title: 加拿大央行下调存款利率似乎能缓解回购市场压力
item.description: 加拿大央行的一位官员表示，央行最近对其存款利率设定方式的改变正在改善货币市场的运作，降低借贷成本。【原文：A Bank of Canada official said a recent change in how the central bank sets its deposit rate is working to improve the functioning of money markets, lowering borrowing costs.】

item.title: 债券市场并不完全买马斯克的 DOGE 所卖的东西
item.description:
美国财政部的收益率为白宫的削减成本誓言提供了一个记分卡

。【原文：

US Treasury yields offer a scorecard for the White House’s cost-cutting vows

】

item.title: 投资者批评 TFI 迁往美国后，TFI 将继续留在加拿大
item.description: TFI International Inc. 不会将总部迁往美国，称将 "根据迄今收到的股东反馈 "保留其加拿大公司的地位。【原文：TFI International Inc. won’t move its headquarters to the US, saying it will retain its Canadian corporation status “based on feedback from shareholders received to date.”】

item.title: 肯-格里芬为朱莉娅-科赫的公园大道合作公寓支付 4,500 万美元
item.description: 亿万富翁肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）又添一处豪宅，在曼哈顿最高档的合作公寓楼之一买下了一套公寓。【原文：Billionaire Ken Griffin has added another luxury home to his collection, buying an apartment in one of Manhattan’s most exclusive co-op buildings.】

item.title: 禽流感使美国鸡群数量锐减，产蛋鸡数量创九年新低
item.description: 由于禽流感导致数百万只家禽死亡，1 月份美国的蛋鸡数量降至 2016 年以来的最低水平，鸡蛋价格也因此创下历史新高。【原文：America’s flock of egg-laying hens dropped to the lowest since 2016 in January as avian influenza resulted in the death of millions of birds, driving egg prices to record levels.】

item.title: Zoom 前景黯淡，表明新产品回报缓慢
item.description: Zoom Communications Inc. 预计今年的收入增长将低于预期，这使人们对扩大产品套件将带来销售激增的乐观情绪变得暗淡。【原文：Zoom Communications Inc. projected worse-than-expected revenue growth for the year, dimming optimism that an expanded suite of products will bring a sales surge.】

item.title: 资金外流 1200 亿美元后，Wamco 任命四名副首席信息官
item.description: 西方资产管理公司（Western Asset Management Co.【原文：Western Asset Management Co. named four deputy chief investment officers, seeking to emphasize a “team-based approach” in the aftermath of criminal fraud charges against the bond manager’s former star trader and veteran Ken Leech.】

item.title: 美国银行称，特朗普寻求降低油价，欧佩克+将增加石油产量
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）石油交易主管杰森-普莱尔（Jason Prior）表示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普呼吁 "欧佩克+"降低原油价格后，预计 "欧佩克+"将在 4 月份恢复部分削减的原油产量。【原文：OPEC+ is expected to revive some curtailed crude production in April following US President Donald Trump’s appeals to the group to lower prices, said Jason Prior, Bank of America Corp.’s head of oil trading.】

item.title: 日本最高地区银行因押注利率攀升而暂停购买日本国债
item.description: 距离东京约一小时火车车程的一个交易室是日本政府债券投资者的关注焦点，他们正等待着国内银行是否会认真恢复购买该国的债务。【原文：A trading room about an hour’s train ride from Tokyo is on the radar of Japanese government bond investors waiting to see whether domestic banks will resume buying the nation’s debt in earnest.】

item.title: 纽约市公共交通管理局官员称，终止公共汽车减税 "将是致命的"。
item.description: 市政债券市场最大的发行商之一警告说，如果联邦立法者取消市政债务免税政策，它可能需要缩减借款计划。【原文：One of the biggest issuers in the municipal-bond market is warning it may need to scale back its borrowing plans if federal lawmakers eliminate the tax-exemption on municipal debt.】

item.title: 西班牙电信公司以 12.5 亿美元出售阿根廷业务引起米莱公司的关注
item.description: 西班牙电信公司（Telefonica SA）周一同意以 12.5 亿美元的价格将其在阿根廷的业务出售给当地公司阿根廷电信公司（Telecom Argentina SA），但阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）立即警告说，阿根廷政府将审查该交易，认为其可能造成垄断。【原文：Telefonica SA agreed on Monday to sell its operations in Argentina to local firm Telecom Argentina SA for $1.25 billion, though President Javier Milei immediately warned his government would review the transaction as a possible monopoly.】

item.title: Dye & Durham 收到 Plantro 提出的私有化要约
item.description: 据知情人士透露，软件公司 Dye & Durham Ltd. 的一位大股东以比上周收盘价高出 70% 的溢价收购了该公司。【原文：A major shareholder of software company Dye & Durham Ltd. made an approach to take the company private at a 70% premium to last week’s closing price, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普联邦贸易委员会主席承诺继续积极执行兼并法
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的联邦贸易委员会新任主席周一表示，该机构将 "大力 "起诉阻止非法兼并，并强调支持拜登时代屡屡出现的交易挑战。【原文：President Donald Trump’s Federal Trade Commission will “vigorously” sue to block illegal mergers, the agency’s new chairman said Monday, highlighting support for the repeated deal challenges during the Biden era.】

item.title: 特朗普称下月将对墨西哥和加拿大征收关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统说，他预计计划对加拿大和墨西哥征收的关税将于下月生效，而最初的推迟是为了让这两个国家有更多的时间来解决他对边境安全的担忧。【原文：President Donald Trump said he expected tariffs planned to take effect on Canada and Mexico to go ahead next month following an initial delay to allow the countries more time to address his concerns over border security.】

item.title: 英国央行丁格拉称渐进式降息将拖累经济
item.description: 英国央行决策者斯瓦蒂-丁格拉（Swati Dhingra）详细阐述了她呼吁降息的决定，称采取 "渐进 "的方式仍将使货币政策在今年拖累经济。【原文：Bank of England policymaker Swati Dhingra has elaborated on her decision to call for interest rates to be slashed, saying taking a “gradual” approach would still leave monetary policy as a drag on the economy this year.】

item.title: 联邦快递完成债务交换，将货运部门撤为担保人
item.description: 联邦快递公司（FedEx Corp. ）称，其债券持有人同意将其货运业务从贷款文件中删除，将其作为有义务帮助公司偿还债务的一方，从而使这家航运巨头更容易将货运业务分拆成一家新公司。【原文：FedEx Corp. said its bondholders agreed to remove its freight business from its lending documents as a party obligated to help pay the company’s debt, making it easier for the shipping giant to spin the business off into a new company.】

item.title: 前美国国家航空航天局（NASA）领导人从未听过马斯克提前遣返宇航员的提议
item.description: 美国国家航空航天局（NASA）前副局长告诉彭博社，该局高层从未收到埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 SpaceX 公司提出的让两名被困太空的美国宇航员提前回家的提议。【原文：NASA’s top officials never received an offer from Elon Musk’s SpaceX to bring home two US astronauts marooned in space earlier than planned, the agency’s former deputy administrator told Bloomberg.】

item.title: 纽约市新学校因招生人数减少而评级展望被下调
item.description: 位于曼哈顿市中心的私立大学新学校（New School）在连续两年招生人数下降后，被穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）下调了信用展望。【原文：The New School, a private university in downtown Manhattan, had its credit outlook cut by Moody’s Ratings after two consecutive years of declining enrollment.】

item.title: 伊利诺伊州计划出售 7.25 亿美元债券用于资本预算
item.description: 据一份文件显示，伊利诺伊州计划出售 7.25 亿美元的债券，这些债券由用于资本项目的销售税收入支持。【原文：Illinois is planning to sell $725 million in bonds backed by sales tax revenue for capital projects, according to a filing.】

item.title: 东京通胀指标受关注，日元波动率接近六周高点
item.description: 追踪日元近期价格波动的一个指标周一攀升，接近六周高点，因为交易商一方面要应对通胀压力加大的前景，另一方面日本央行警告不要让债券收益率迅速飙升。【原文：A gauge tracking near-term price swings in the Japanese yen climbed on Monday, approaching a six-week high as traders grappled with the prospect of more inflationary pressure on one hand and Bank of Japan warnings against a quick surge in bond yields on the other.】

item.title: Cemex 探讨出售哥伦比亚水泥业务
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，随着墨西哥水泥生产商退出非核心资产以专注于北美和欧洲市场，Cemex SAB 正在探索出售其哥伦比亚业务。【原文：Cemex SAB is exploring a sale of its Colombian business as the Mexican cement maker exits non-core assets to focus on North America and Europe, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 金融科技公司 Brex 筹划首次公开募股，希望在 2025 年实现 5 亿美元收入
item.description: Brex是考虑首次公开募股的几家金融科技初创公司之一，该公司首席执行官佩德罗-弗兰切斯基（Pedro Franceschi）表示，在决定进行首次公开募股之前，公司希望确保已准备好向投资者展示可预测的业务。【原文：Brex, one of several financial-technology startups that’s considering an initial-public offering, wants to make sure it’s ready to present investors with a predictable business before it decides on pursuing an IPO, according to Chief Executive Officer Pedro Franceschi.】

item.title: 加密货币 "情绪不佳 "继续拖累阿尔特币和以太币
item.description: 以太币和许多知名度较高的另类币（如 Solana 和 Dogecoin）仍然面临压力，而投资者则转向其他地方，因为该行业在上周遭到有史以来最大的黑客攻击后仍在徘徊。【原文：Ether and many of the higher profile altcoins such as Solana and Dogecoin remain under pressure while investors turn elsewhere with the sector still reeling after its biggest-ever hack last week.】
